intro: Ixora lobbii var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ixora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of bright orange-red flowers. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
